div.div: ἀ-μύ̄μων , ονος (μωμος): blameless, excellent, both of persons and things, ὃς δ᾽ ἂν ἀμύ̄μων αὐτὸς ἔῃ καὶ ἀμύ̄μονα εἰδῇ, Od. 19.332 (opp. ἀπηνής, 329); often to mark personal appearance or nobility of birth, and sometimes without regard to moral excellence, ἀμύ̄μονος Αἰγίσθοιο, Od. 1.29; θεοῦ ἐς ἀμύ̄μονα νῆσον (‘faultless’ isle, because it belonged to the god), Od. 12.261.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
